body:
**Is this a BUG REPORT or FEATURE REQUEST?**:

/kind bug
@kubernetes/sig-testing-bugs for lack of better idea

hack/make-rules/test-cmd-util.sh, line 1443 is failing, even when the debug output shows the expected text:

```
  ### Test kubectl get watch
  output_message=$(kubectl get pods -w --request-timeout=1 "${kube_flags[@]}")
  kube::test::if_has_string "${output_message}" 'STATUS'    # headers
```

from the test log:
```
W1229 08:19:59.957] E1229 08:19:59.956134   14728 streamwatcher.go:109] Unable to decode an event from the watch stream: net/http: request canceled (Client.Timeout exceeded while reading body)
W1229 08:19:59.968] !!! [1229 08:19:59] Call tree:
W1229 08:19:59.971] !!! [1229 08:19:59]  1: /go/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/hack/make-rules/../../third_party/forked/shell2junit/sh2ju.sh:38 run_kubectl_get_tests(...)
W1229 08:19:59.973] !!! [1229 08:19:59]  2: /go/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/hack/make-rules/../../third_party/forked/shell2junit/sh2ju.sh:103 eVal(...)
W1229 08:19:59.976] !!! [1229 08:19:59]  3: /go/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/hack/make-rules/test-cmd-util.sh:106 juLog(...)
W1229 08:19:59.979] !!! [1229 08:19:59]  4: /go/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/hack/make-rules/test-cmd-util.sh:4700 record_command(...)
W1229 08:19:59.982] !!! [1229 08:19:59]  5: hack/make-rules/test-cmd.sh:103 runTests(...)
I1229 08:20:00.082] FAIL!
I1229 08:20:00.083] message:NAME        READY     STATUS    RESTARTS   AGE
I1229 08:20:00.083] valid-pod   0/1       Pending   0          1s
I1229 08:20:00.084] has not:STATUS
I1229 08:20:00.084] 1443 /go/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/hack/make-rules/test-cmd-util.sh
```

**What happened**:

See for example https://k8s-gubernator.appspot.com/build/kubernetes-jenkins/pr-logs/pull/57700/pull-kubernetes-unit/72740/

title: test-cmd run_kubectl_get_tests "Client.Timeout exceeded while reading body" fails output test
